newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft, Reynolds and Reynolds in deal.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft, Reynolds and Reynolds in deal.

text.p: Microsoft Corp said Monday it has reached an agreement with Reynolds and Reynolds Co to offer used car listings on the Microsoft CarPoint automotive Internet site.
Microsoft said the service, to be available beginning sometime in the spring, would allow computer users to search for used cars by make, model, price range and geographic preference.
Participating dealers will be able to upload their inventories to the system daily.

The service will be free to consumers, although dealers would pay to have their cars listed in the online classified ads. Pricing will be released Saturday at an industry trade show in Atlanta, a spokesman for Reynolds and Reynolds said.

Reynolds and Reynolds, based in Dayton, Ohio, maintains an automotive Internet site called DealerNet that includes listings from more than 700 dealers, who will initially be targeted to contribute to the new service.
Microsoft said its goal is to expand the system to include all 17,000 of the nation's dealerships with computerized inventory systems.
The CarPoint site is available to Internet users at http://carpoint.msn.com/, while DealerNet is at http://www.dealernet.com.
